scholarships.name: Loran Scholars Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Deadline for the 2025/2026 application cycle is typically mid-October.
scholarships.description_raw: The Loran Scholars Foundation looks for students who demonstrate character, service, and leadership potential. The award includes an annual stipend, matching tuition waiver, summer internships, and mentorship.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be graduating high school students who hold Canadian citizenship or permanent resident status and meet a minimum academic average (usually 85% or equivalent).
essay_prompts_raw: Varies; typically focuses on leadership experiences, service, and personal character.

source.found_via: google search: top canadian undergraduate scholarships
source.notes: Academic threshold (85%) inferred from common guidance, not strict GPA scale.

scholarships.name: TD Scholarships for Community Leadership
scholarships.deadline_note: Typically mid-November.
scholarships.description_raw: Recognizes students who are making a difference in their communities. Awards cover tuition and maintenance for up to four years of study.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be in the final year of high school or Cu00e9gep, demonstrate outstanding community leadership, and plan to enter an accredited Canadian university or college.
essay_prompts_raw: Describe your community leadership experience and the impact you have made.

source.found_via: google search: top canadian undergraduate scholarships
source.notes: Amount is up to $70,000 paid over four years, plus $7,500 for summer employment.

scholarships.name: Schulich Leader Scholarships
scholarships.deadline_note: Nomination deadline typically late January; application deadline typically February.
scholarships.description_raw: Schulich Leader Scholarships are awarded to entrepreneurial-minded high school graduates enrolling in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math (STEM) programs at partner universities.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be nominated by their high school and be graduating students enrolling in a STEM program at a partner Canadian university.
essay_prompts_raw: Varies based on category: Engineering vs. Science/Technology/Math. Focuses on why you chose STEM and your entrepreneurial spirit.

source.found_via: google search: major canadian scholarships for stem
source.notes: Nomination required prior to application. 50 scholarships in Canada (20 Engineering, 30 Science/Tech/Math), 50 in US.

scholarships.name: Horatio Alger Canadian Scholarship Program
scholarships.deadline_note: Typically late October.
scholarships.description_raw: The scholarship assists students who have demonstrated integrity and perseverance in overcoming personal adversity and who desire to pursue higher education.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be in the final year of high school with plans to enter university or college, demonstrate critical financial need, and maintain a minimum 2.0 GPA.
essay_prompts_raw: Describe the adversity you have faced and how you have overcome it.

source.found_via: google search: financial need canadian scholarships high school
source.notes: Minimum GPA is 2.0 on a 4.0 scale.

scholarships.name: RBC Future Launch Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Three application cycles per year (Spring, Summer, Fall). Check website for specific dates.
scholarships.description_raw: The RBC Future Launch Scholarship is designed to help young Canadians aged 15 to 29 access learning opportunities, whether it's related to post-secondary education, skills development, or vocational training.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be Canadian citizens or permanent residents aged 15-29 who are enrolled in or accepted to a qualified educational or training program.
essay_prompts_raw: Describe the learning experience you want to pursue and how it will help you achieve your goals.

source.found_via: google search: canadian vocational scholarships
source.notes: 100 awards given out across three annual cycles.

scholarships.name: Burger King McLamore Foundation Scholars Program (Canada)
scholarships.deadline_note: Typically mid-December.
scholarships.description_raw: Provides scholarships to high school students in the U.S., Canada, and Puerto Rico who are entering post-secondary education and have demonstrated academic achievement and community involvement.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a high school senior (or equivalent) who plans to enroll full-time in an accredited US or Canadian post-secondary institution and have a minimum 2.5 GPA.
essay_prompts_raw: Topics focus on future goals, community involvement, and overcoming challenges.

source.found_via: google search: corporate scholarships canada high school
source.notes: Most awards are $1,000, but a few 'Scholars' awards go up to $50,000.

scholarships.name: Hydro One Indigenous Student Award
scholarships.deadline_note: Varies by year; check website. Typically opens in Spring/Summer.
scholarships.description_raw: This award supports Indigenous students pursuing studies related to the energy sector, offering financial assistance, paid summer employment, and mentorship.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a status or non-status First Nation, Mu00e9tis, or Inuit student. Must be enrolled in a degree, diploma, or trade program. Priority given to fields relevant to Hydro One operations.
essay_prompts_raw: Essay on personal journey, academic goals, and interest in the energy sector.

source.found_via: google search: indigenous student scholarships canada undergrad
source.notes: Covers UG and Masters, meeting the requirement to not be exclusively for advanced degrees.

scholarships.name: Kin Canada Bursaries (Hal Rogers Endowment Fund)
scholarships.deadline_note: Annual deadline is usually February 1st.
scholarships.description_raw: These bursaries are awarded to successful applicants based on their community service, academic standards, and knowledge of Kin Canada.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Open to all students who are pursuing post-secondary education, who demonstrate high standards of academic achievement and community involvement. Must be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident.
essay_prompts_raw: Explain how you exhibit leadership and community involvement and how receiving this bursary would help you achieve your goals.

source.found_via: google search: canadian community service bursaries
source.notes: 35 awards of $1,000 each.

scholarships.name: Terry Fox Humanitarian Award
scholarships.deadline_note: Application typically opens November 1st and closes February 1st.
scholarships.description_raw: The award recognizes young humanitarians who have demonstrated the highest ideals of courage, achievement, and citizenship, who are in pursuit of higher education.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a student graduating high school or already enrolled in a first university degree program, who has demonstrated extraordinary humanitarian commitment through voluntary contributions to community and country.
essay_prompts_raw: Detailed essay focusing on humanitarian involvement, personal obstacles, and future goals.

source.found_via: google search: canadian humanitarian award
source.notes: Up to $7,000 annually for up to four years ($28,000 maximum).

scholarships.name: University of Toronto National Scholarship Program
scholarships.deadline_note: Application typically due early November for following Fall admission.
scholarships.description_raw: The National Scholarship is U of T's most prestigious award for Canadian and international students entering first year of university. It recognizes superior academic achievement, original and creative thought, and exceptional accomplishment in extracurricular activities.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Outstanding high school students entering U of T directly from secondary school. Must demonstrate academic excellence, creativity, and community involvement.
essay_prompts_raw: Requires a supplemental application which includes essay components related to achievements and impact.

source.found_via: google search: prestigious canadian university entrance scholarships
source.notes: The amount varies. 'Entrance Scholar' is $10k, 'National Scholar' is full funding.

scholarships.name: Google SVA Scholarship (Student Veterans of America)
scholarships.deadline_note: Application dates typically run November through January. Varies annually.
scholarships.description_raw: The Google SVA Scholarship supports U.S. and Canadian veteran students pursuing degrees in computer science or related fields.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be currently enrolled in or accepted to a degree program in computer science or related fields, maintain a strong academic performance (3.0 GPA minimum), and be a student veteran (active, reserve, or dependent).
essay_prompts_raw: Focus on leadership, overcoming challenges in transitioning from military to academia, and interest in technology.

source.found_via: google search: canadian stem scholarships for veterans
source.notes: Covers UG/Grad. Open to both US and CA citizens/residents.

scholarships.name: Generation Google Scholarship (North America)
scholarships.deadline_note: Application typically opens in Fall and closes in early December.
scholarships.description_raw: The Generation Google Scholarship for North America helps current high school seniors and undergraduate students who are pursuing computer science degrees and belong to historically underrepresented groups in technology.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be enrolling in or currently enrolled in a US or Canadian university for the upcoming academic year, pursuing a degree in Computer Science, and demonstrate financial need.
essay_prompts_raw: Focus on leadership, commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and how technology will impact the future.

source.found_via: google search: canadian stem scholarships diversity
source.notes: Targeted specifically at US/CA, HS/UG level.

scholarships.name: The Gates Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: High school nomination usually closes in September. Final application typically closes in January.
scholarships.description_raw: A highly selective scholarship for outstanding minority high school seniors from low-income households, funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. The scholarship is a full cost of attendance scholarship (tuition, fees, room, board, books, transportation, personal expenses).
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a high school senior, from at least one of the following ethnicities: African-American, American Indian/Alaska Native, Asian & Pacific Islander, Hispanic-American. Must be Pell-eligible and have a minimum GPA of 3.3.
essay_prompts_raw: Essays focus on academic motivation, leadership, and personal background.

source.found_via: google search: top us scholarships high school
source.notes: Full cost of attendance; non-numeric amount. US focused, meets the 70% threshold.

scholarships.name: Coca-Cola Scholars Program
scholarships.deadline_note: Application typically runs August through October 31st.
scholarships.description_raw: The Coca-Cola Scholars Program recognizes 150 high school seniors each year who have demonstrated outstanding leadership, achievement, and service in their communities.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a current high school senior anticipating graduation during the current academic year, intending to pursue a degree at an accredited US institution, and maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA.
essay_prompts_raw: Short essays focusing on community service, leadership roles, and personal impact.

source.found_via: google search: top us scholarships high school leadership

scholarships.deadline_note: Deadline varies by partner institution (e.g., McMaster University). Usually early Spring.

scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be entering first year of full-time undergraduate study at an accredited Canadian college or university. Strong academic record and commitment to community service required.

scholarships.name: Alexander Rutherford Scholarship (Alberta)
scholarships.deadline_note: Can be applied for after the student starts post-secondary studies. No specific deadline for application once enrolled.

scholarships.name: Ontario First Generation Bursary

scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be an Ontario resident, studying full-time in an eligible program, and be a 'first-generation' student (neither parent has attended post-secondary education). Must qualify for OSAP funding.

scholarships.deadline_note: Application typically runs through the Fall.
scholarships.description_raw: BMO offers several scholarships targeted at professional students (Medical, Law, MBA) but also includes a general undergraduate category for high-achieving students in fields like Business and Engineering.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be enrolled in an eligible program at a recognized Canadian university. Focus is on academic achievement and professional potential.
essay_prompts_raw: Focus on career aspirations and impact in the chosen professional field.

source.found_via: google search: bmo professional student scholarships
source.notes: Includes undergraduate slots in the overall program. Amount varies by program.

scholarships.name: Western University National Scholarship Program
scholarships.deadline_note: Pre-application typically due mid-February.
scholarships.description_raw: The National Scholarship is designed to recognize students from across Canada who demonstrate exceptional academic achievement and promise, as well as outstanding creative and innovative achievement in their school and community life.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be entering the first year of a full-time undergraduate degree program at Western. Requires a minimum academic average of 90% or equivalent, and demonstrated leadership.
essay_prompts_raw: Supplementary application including essays on leadership, community involvement, and financial need.

source.found_via: google search: canadian university major entrance scholarships
source.notes: Amount covers various tiers, from $20,000 to full tuition/residence.

scholarships.name: Baker Hughes Indigenous STEM Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Deadline varies; typically opens in Fall.
scholarships.description_raw: Scholarship program intended to encourage Indigenous students to pursue higher education in STEM and trades fields, supporting energy industry diversity.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must identify as Indigenous (First Nations, Mu00e9tis, Inuit in Canada; Native American/Alaskan Native in US). Must be enrolled in or accepted to an eligible STEM or Trades program.
essay_prompts_raw: Essay addressing personal background, academic goals, and interest in the energy/technical sectors.

source.found_via: google search: baker hughes indigenous scholarship canada
source.notes: Open to US/CA Indigenous students. Amount range estimated.

scholarships.name: Enbridge Fueling Futures Scholarship Program
scholarships.deadline_note: Application deadline typically end of April.
scholarships.description_raw: Provides financial aid to students who are pursuing post-secondary education in fields relevant to the energy industry, with specific streams for Indigenous, women, and diverse students.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be enrolled in a university or college program in an eligible field (STEM, Trades, Business). Specific streams require Indigenous identity, female identity, or demonstrated financial need.
essay_prompts_raw: Personal statement focusing on community involvement, academic goals, and connection to energy/sustainability.

source.found_via: google search: enbridge scholarship indigenous
source.notes: 150 awards across 4 streams (Indigenous, Women in Trades, Community Leaders, etc.).

scholarships.name: CFUW Graduate Women's Fellowships and Awards
scholarships.deadline_note: Application deadline typically February 1st.
scholarships.description_raw: Supports female graduate students who are pursuing advanced studies, recognizing academic excellence and commitment to research.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a female Canadian citizen or permanent resident enrolled in graduate studies at a recognized university. Based primarily on scholarly merit and research quality.
essay_prompts_raw: Detailed research proposal and statement of academic achievement.

source.found_via: google search: canadian graduate fellowships women
source.notes: Exclusively Masters/PhD, included for gender/research diversity, meets the 30% exception rule.

scholarships.name: Hydro One Be Bright Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Typically mid-May for the subsequent academic year.
scholarships.description_raw: Targeted at students entering university or college for the first time who demonstrate strong academic potential and financial need.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be entering first year of post-secondary study in Canada. Must demonstrate financial need.

source.found_via: google search: hydro one scholarships high school financial need
source.notes: General need-based scholarship component, complementing their Indigenous and technical awards.

scholarships.name: The Future is Female Scholarship (by Top Hat)
scholarships.deadline_note: Deadline typically in early November.
scholarships.description_raw: Awarded to female-identifying students who are pursuing post-secondary education in North America and demonstrate a commitment to leadership and academic success in traditionally male-dominated fields.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be enrolled full-time in an undergraduate program in the US or Canada. Must identify as female.
essay_prompts_raw: Essay submission on how they plan to lead and inspire in their chosen field.

source.found_via: google search: canadian women leadership scholarships
source.notes: Open to both US and CA students, UG level.

scholarships.name: AAUW International Fellowships
scholarships.deadline_note: Application deadline typically November 15th.
scholarships.description_raw: Provides support for women pursuing full-time graduate or postdoctoral study in the United States who are not U.S. citizens or permanent residents.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Female students who are citizens of a country other than the U.S. or Permanent Residents. Must hold an academic degree equivalent to a US bachelor's degree and intend to return to their home country to pursue a professional career.
essay_prompts_raw: Focus on academic plan, career goals, and impact the applicant intends to make in their home country.

source.found_via: google search: international women graduate scholarships US
source.notes: Exclusively Masters/PhD/Postdoc for non-US citizens studying in the US. Included for international/women diversity, meets the 30% exception rule.

scholarships.name: University of Manitoba Entrance Scholarship Program
scholarships.deadline_note: Application typically closes March 1st. Many are automatic.
scholarships.description_raw: Awards are given to students with high academic standing entering their first year of study directly from high school. Includes both renewable and one-time awards.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be entering the U of M for the first time directly from high school. Academic average determines automatic entrance scholarship value (e.g., 95%+ average for highest tier).

source.found_via: google search: university of manitoba entrance scholarships
source.notes: Automatic awards start at $1,000; specific competitive awards go higher.

scholarships.name: StudentAid BC Grants and Bursaries (BC)
scholarships.deadline_note: Rolling, application integrated with student loan process.
scholarships.description_raw: Various non-repayable grants and bursaries provided by the provincial government to BC residents who demonstrate financial need.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a BC resident, Canadian citizen or permanent resident, enrolled in an eligible post-secondary program, and meet financial need criteria.

source.found_via: google search: british columbia student grants
source.notes: Example of a major provincial financial aid program.

scholarships.name: CST Inspired Minds Learning Project Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Project submission deadline typically mid-November.
scholarships.description_raw: Awards high school students for innovative projects that benefit the learning experiences of others in Canada.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be a Canadian resident and a high school student (or Cu00e9gep in Quebec) who demonstrates original thinking and innovation through a submitted project.
essay_prompts_raw: Project description and essay detailing the innovation, its impact on learning, and its future potential.

source.found_via: google search: canadian high school innovation scholarship
source.notes: 10 awards of $5,000 and 5 awards of $10,000.

scholarships.name: Women Techmakers Scholars Program (US & Canada)
scholarships.deadline_note: Deadline typically in early December; placeholder date for dataset  confirm each cycle.
scholarships.description_raw: Women Techmakers Scholars Program, formerly the Google Anita Borg Memorial Scholarship, supports women in computer science and related technical fields with a one-time scholarship plus community and professional development opportunities.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must identify as female; be enrolled or intending to enroll full-time in a Bachelors, Masters, or PhD program in computer science, computer engineering, or a closely related technical field at an accredited university in the United States or Canada; demonstrate strong academic performance and leadership, and show passion for increasing the involvement of women in technology.
essay_prompts_raw: Describe your contributions to supporting women in technology and how this scholarship will help you further that impact.
Share a challenge you faced in your academic or personal journey and how you demonstrated resilience and leadership.

source.found_via: university funding pages describing Women Techmakers Scholars Program
source.notes: Award size ($10k USD / $5k CAD) and female CS/tech focus taken from university funding descriptions and program summaries. Essays and exact number of letters approximated for dataset; confirm via current application guidelines.

scholarships.name: Google Lime Scholarship for Students with Disabilities
scholarships.deadline_note: Typically closes in April; placeholder date for dataset  confirm on Lime Connect or Google.
scholarships.description_raw: The Google Lime Scholarship supports undergraduate students with visible or invisible disabilities who are pursuing degrees in computer science, computer engineering, or closely related technical fields and who demonstrate academic excellence and passion for technology.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must have, or consider themselves to have, a visible or invisible disability; be currently enrolled as full-time undergraduate students in the U.S. or Canada, and intend to be enrolled full-time in a Bachelors program in computer science, computer engineering, or a closely related technical field in the coming academic year; demonstrate a strong academic record and leadership in computer science and technology.
essay_prompts_raw: Explain how your disability experience has shaped your journey in technology and your goals in computer science.
Describe a project, initiative, or experience that shows your passion for computer science and your impact on others.

source.found_via: MALDEF & university scholarship guides summarizing Google Lime Scholarship
source.notes: Eligibility (disability, CS/CE, US/Canada) and award value (~$10,000) taken from scholarship resource guides. Essay structure approximated for dataset.

scholarships.name: Point Foundation Flagship Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Flagship Scholarship deadlines typically fall in January; placeholder date  confirm each year.
scholarships.description_raw: The Point Flagship Scholarship is the flagship program of Point Foundation, providing financial support, mentoring, leadership development and community-building opportunities to LGBTQ+ students pursuing undergraduate or graduate degrees in the United States.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must identify as LGBTQ+; be enrolled or intending to enroll in an accredited U.S. institution; demonstrate academic achievement (typically minimum 3.3 GPA), proven leadership, and significant involvement in LGBTQ+ or social justice causes, and show financial need.
essay_prompts_raw: Describe your journey as an LGBTQ+ person and how it has shaped your goals, leadership, and commitment to community.
Explain how you plan to use your education to create positive change for LGBTQ+ communities or other marginalized groups.

source.found_via: Point Foundation site and press coverage describing flagship LGBTQ+ scholarship
source.notes: Point describes itself as the largest LGBTQ+ scholarship provider in the US; program includes financial support, mentorship, and leadership training. Amount range and essay details approximated for demo; verify in current cycle.

scholarships.name: Mike Rowe WORKS Work Ethic Scholarship
scholarships.deadline_note: Recent cycles list mid-April deadlines (e.g., April 17); update each year from program guidelines.
scholarships.description_raw: The Work Ethic Scholarship Program supports students pursuing training in skilled trades, emphasizing strong work ethic, personal responsibility, and commitment to hands-on careers. The foundation awards millions of dollars in scholarships each year for approved trade programs.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must plan to enroll in an approved trade or technical program in the United States; sign the S.W.E.A.T. Pledge; demonstrate a strong work ethic and commitment to a career in the skilled trades; and complete a multi-step application including written responses, references, and documentation of program costs.
essay_prompts_raw: Answer four questions reflecting on the S.W.E.A.T. Pledge and how its principles show up in your life and work.
Explain why you chose your trade and how you plan to use your skills to contribute to your community.

source.found_via: Scholarship aggregators summarizing Mike Rowe Work Ethic Scholarship and official MRW site
source.notes: Scholarship description, trade focus, multi-step process, and award ceiling (~$20,000) from official foundation info and scholarship summaries. Exact per-student amount and number of awards vary annually.

scholarships.name: YoungArts National Arts Competition
scholarships.provider_name: National Foundation for Advancement in the Arts (YoungArts)
scholarships.deadline_note: Recent competition deadlines fall in October (e.g., Oct 17); confirm exact date each year.
scholarships.description_raw: YoungArts is a national arts competition that identifies and supports young artists in the United States, providing cash awards, mentorship, and national recognition. Awards range from modest prizes to up to $10,000 for top winners.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be U.S. citizens or permanent residents (or otherwise legally authorized to receive income in the U.S.), in grades 1012 or aged 1518 at the time of application, and submit high-quality work in eligible artistic disciplines. Selection is based primarily on artistic merit rather than GPA or financial need.

source.found_via: Scholarships.com YoungArts National Arts Competition listing and YoungArts site
source.notes: Award range ($250$10,000) and eligibility (grades 1012 or age 1518, U.S. citizenship/PR/authorized to work) from scholarship listing. Program is primarily portfolio-based; no traditional essay prompt required.

scholarships.name: AAUW Selected Professions Fellowship
scholarships.deadline_note: Recent AAUW cycle lists early October deadlines (e.g., Oct 7); confirm in each call.
scholarships.description_raw: AAUW Selected Professions Fellowships provide $20,000 fellowships to women pursuing their first full-time masters or professional degrees in fields where women have historically been underrepresented, especially in STEM and certain professional disciplines.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must identify as women; be U.S. citizens or permanent residents; be pursuing a first full-time masters or professional degree in an eligible field such as architecture, natural and physical sciences, technology, engineering, mathematics, or medicine at an accredited institution; and demonstrate academic excellence, leadership, and a commitment to serving under-resourced communities or supporting women and girls.
essay_prompts_raw: Describe your academic and professional goals and how this fellowship will help you contribute to your field.
Explain your commitment to supporting women and girls or under-resourced communities through your work.

source.found_via: AAUW official fellowship page
source.notes: $20,000 stipend, eligible fields, and citizenship requirements taken directly from AAUW. Essay structure approximated based on stated selection criteria (leadership, service, support for women and girls).

scholarships.name: DAAD Helmut-Schmidt-Programme  Masters Scholarships for Public Policy and Good Governance
scholarships.deadline_note: Current calls list application windows JuneJuly (e.g., until July 31); confirm in the specific call for the chosen cycle.
scholarships.description_raw: The Helmut-Schmidt-Programme offers fully funded masters scholarships in Germany for future leaders from developing and emerging countries in fields related to public policy, good governance, and development. Scholarships cover tuition, living expenses, travel, insurance, and a mandatory German language course.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must hold a first university degree with above-average grades (usually in social and political sciences, law, economics, public policy, or administration); come from countries eligible for official development assistance; show a strong commitment to the social, political, and economic development of their home countries; and have relevant practical experience such as professional work, internships, or social/political engagement.
essay_prompts_raw: Explain your motivation for studying public policy, governance, or a related field in Germany and how this aligns with the goals of the Helmut-Schmidt-Programme.
Describe how you plan to contribute to good governance and social or economic development in your home country after your studies.

source.found_via: DAAD official Helmut-Schmidt-Programme description and current call PDFs
source.notes: Objectives, fully funded nature, fields of study, and target group (future leaders from developing/emerging countries) taken from DAAD. Award amounts vary by stipend and benefits rather than simple lump sum.

scholarships.name: DAFI  Albert Einstein German Academic Refugee Initiative
scholarships.deadline_note: Application periods vary by host country; many calls open mid-year. Date here is a placeholder; use country-specific call data.
scholarships.description_raw: The DAFI (Albert Einstein German Academic Refugee Initiative) scholarship programme offers qualified refugee and returnee students the possibility to earn undergraduate degrees or equivalent technical qualifications in their country of asylum or home country. It has supported tens of thousands of refugee students with tuition, stipends, and additional academic and psychosocial support.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be recognized refugees or asylum seekers in a participating host country; have completed secondary education and meet local university entry requirements; typically be below an upper age limit; and show academic potential and financial vulnerability. DAFI covers tuition, books, a monthly stipend, housing or housing allowance, local transportation, and sometimes health insurance and mentoring.

source.found_via: UNHCR DAFI programme pages and global report
source.notes: DAFI is multi-country with varying local rules. Description and coverage (tuition, stipend, housing, transport, health, mentoring) taken from UNHCR opportunity and FAQ pages. This record is intentionally generic for demo; for production, create per-country records with specific details.

scholarships.name: Jason Lang Scholarship (Alberta)
scholarships.deadline_note: Awarded automatically by post-secondary institution based on academic performance.
scholarships.description_raw: Recognizes and rewards Alberta post-secondary students who have achieved academic excellence in any year of an undergraduate program.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be an Alberta resident, Canadian citizen/permanent resident, enrolled full-time in an undergraduate program, and achieved a minimum GPA of 3.2 (B+ equivalent) in the previous year of study.

source.found_via: google search: alberta continuing undergraduate scholarships
source.notes: Automatic award for continuing high-GPA students. $1,000 per year.

scholarships.name: Rotman Commerce National Scholarship (U of T)
scholarships.deadline_note: Application deadline usually early November (same as general U of T scholarship deadline).
scholarships.description_raw: One of the most prestigious entrance awards for students entering the Rotman Commerce program, recognizing exceptional academic achievement, creativity, and leadership in business potential.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be applying directly from high school to the Rotman Commerce program at U of T. Requires exceptional academic average (high 90s) and demonstrated leadership through extracurriculars.
essay_prompts_raw: Supplemental application requiring short essays and video submission focused on problem-solving and leadership.

source.found_via: google search: rotman commerce entrance scholarship
source.notes: Amounts vary, highest tier is full funding.

scholarships.name: Global Citizen Excellence Scholarship (University of Edinburgh)
scholarships.deadline_note: Deadline typically end of March.
scholarships.description_raw: A merit-based scholarship for international students entering their first year of undergraduate study at the University of Edinburgh.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Applicants must be accepted for admission to a full-time undergraduate program and be classified as an overseas student for tuition fee purposes.
essay_prompts_raw: Personal statement outlining why they chose their program and academic goals.

source.found_via: google search: UK scholarships for international undergrads
source.notes: UK based scholarship for international UG students (including Canadian students). Renewable up to 4 years.

scholarships.name: Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships (Vanier CGS)
scholarships.deadline_note: Nomination deadline typically November 1st.
scholarships.description_raw: Attracts and retains world-class doctoral students by supporting those who demonstrate both leadership skills and a high standard of scholarly achievement in graduate studies in social sciences, humanities, natural sciences, engineering, and health.
scholarships.eligibility_raw: Must be nominated by a Canadian institution. Must be pursuing a doctoral degree (or combined MA/PhD) for the first time. Exceptional academic record (often minimum 3.7/4.0 GPA) and strong research potential required.
essay_prompts_raw: Research proposal, personal leadership statement, and detailed contributions.

source.found_via: google search: canadian government doctoral scholarships
source.notes: Exclusively PhD level, included as a high-value, Canadian government international program. Meets the 30% exception rule.
